text:
Looking for suggestions/resources on where to look into understanding commentary about old programming references (notes circa 1950's / 1960's)

aka. could use row on punch cards as "page number" to machine sort dropped group of punch cards, which at 2 ^ 7 gave max ~127 index references.

For higher order number of punch cards & simpler/less expensive sorting, use felt tip marker to add lambda mark along side of block of punch cards.

Best way into front end development for mid 30s career pivot?
text:
I've worked as a musician and supplemented that with video production work for about a decade.

In March 2020 when the world shut down for COVID, I started learning web development. Taught myself modern HTML, CSS, Javascript, React, common JS libraries, SASS/SCSS. Built some portfolio. Hustled and did a bit of freelance work.

I am now attempting to find a job doing front end development, but I'll admit it's pretty discouraging to apply for an entry level job with 100+ other applicants and rarely hear back from the company or recruiter.

What would you suggest to someone like me trying to work their way in?

P.S. Currently learning more about MongoDB, node/express, and Typescript because a lot of jobs ask for experience here. Maybe this is the problem? Just not knowing enough tools?

Ask HN: Who is working on collective intelligence systems?
text:
Which problems of the big picture are you approaching? And how are you approaching them?

I'm active in the canonical debate lab where we research on scalable collaborative argument mapping, voting systems, community moderation, truth algorithms and social protocols.

We'd like so see and motivate a bit more activity in this field.

Recently we tried to identify the main challenges and write them down. Here is the result: https://canonicaldebatelab.com/CIDesign/
